column7: Investigates how culture has been taken up in theories that try to explain differences in educational outcomes between nations, within classrooms, and across schools. Through readings drawn from cultural psychology, but also including sociology, anthropology, and education, students will examine how globalization has shaped the discourse about the relationships between culture, learning, and academic achievement. Same as EPS 553 and EPSY 553. 4 graduate hours. No professional credit. Prerequisite: For majors only.
